$ZIM So let's assume ZIM will keep dropping as much as the dividend it gives out for the next 2 quarters. ZIM will give out $13 pre-tax
created_at: which will drop its price to around $13 in this scenario. ZIM will have ~$40 per share in net cash at the end of the year (got to account for its leases in the liabilities part of the balance sheet)
column3: so market is pricing in that ZIM will perpetually burn through cash. Looking at the income statement pre-covid
column4: ZIM was mostly profitable even when it was leveraged to the teeth. Now ZIM has almost 0 debt
column5: and is earning interest instead on its interest earning investments. So even if we return to pre-covid shipping rates
column6: ZIM will most likely be profitable.
